title: Steamed corn with chipotle mayonnaise and coriander salsa

ingredients.content: 50 g chipotle chillies in adobo sauce, cut into small pieces
½ lime, zest, peeled into strips (1 x 4 cm), no white pith and juiced
3 corn cobs, silks and husks removed and cobs cut into halves
100 g Pecorino cheese, grated, to serve

preparations.content: Place a jug onto mixing bowl lid, weigh oil into jug and set aside.
Place egg yolks, lime juice and salt into mixing bowl and mix <b>15 sec/speed 2<b>.
Mix <b>3 min/speed 4<b>, slowly pouring reserved oil onto lid, letting it drizzle into mixing bowl to emulsify. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chipotle chillies and sour cream and mix <b>15 sec/speed 3<b>, or until incorporated.
Transfer into a sealable container and place into refrigerator until ready to serve. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place onion into mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chilli powder (optional), lime juice and zest, sugar (optional), salt and half the coriander leaves and blend <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add remaining coriander leaves and blend <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>.
Transfer into a sealable container and place into refrigerator until ready to serve. Do not clean mixing bowl.

Place water into mixing bowl. Stand corn halves on their ends in Varoma dish, ensuring there is enough space between cobs to allow steam to circulate. Place Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>12 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, or until cooked to your liking.
Serve corn hot with Chipotle mayonnaise, Coriander salsa and grated Pecorino.

hintsAndTricks: Chipotle in adobo are smoked jalapeño chillies in a tomato, garlic and oregano sauce. They are sold in tins in some supermarkets and specialty food stores. If you cannot find them, replace chillies with 2 teaspoons smoked paprika.
